title: Bloody brilliant! Hayu joins the true crime craze with 35 spine-tingling docuseries now streaming
text:
True crime has become an obsession for streaming service viewers who are always hungry for more content.

And Hayu is coming to the rescue with 35 true crime docuseries now streaming and ready to binge.

Popular titles including Killer Siblings, which premieres on October 28.

The series takes an in-depth look at the upbringings, motivations and crimes of killer siblings.

Hayu has joined the true crime craze with 35 true crime docuseries now streaming. Pictured: The DNA of Murder with Paul Holes

Weaving together the stories of their childhoods with the details of their crimes and the investigations that put them behind bars, the series explores the siblings' bond and what ultimately drove them down a path to murder.

The DNA of Murder with Paul Holes is now streaming on Sundays.

Paul Holes is best known as the retired cold case investigator whose work was instrumental in identifying a suspect in the Golden State Killer case.

This new series follows Holes as he dives into unsolved homicides by analysing the physical and emotional 'DNA' left behind during the violent interaction.

Also now streaming on Mondays is Snapped, a hit true-crime series profiles the fascinating cases of women accused of murder.

It asks, who are these women and what drives them to kill?

Whether the motivation was revenge against a cheating husband, the promise of a hefty insurance payoff, or putting an end to years of abuse, the reasons are as varied as the women themselves.

Other shows now streaming include In Ice Cold Blood, Buried In The Backyard, The Killer Affair, Mysteries & Scandals, A Wedding And A Murder and Relentless With Kate Snow.
